messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: [Rr]oom [0-9]+'

Imagine a world with twelve rooms. From the lobby you have two choices, room 1 and room 2. You enter room 1, at the end thereâ€™s a door that leads to room 3, and room 3 leads to room 5. There is a door in room 5 that leads to room 7 and room 7 leads to room 9. From room 9 you can enter room 11. Thereâ€™s a chest in room 11. You open it and there is 10 dollars, but you do not take any money, youâ€™re just learning about the environment. Then you exit and start over. This time in the lobby you choose room 2, then enter room 4, which leads to room 6. There is a door in room 6 that leads to room 8 and room 8 leads to room 10. At the end there is a door that leads to room 12. Thereâ€™s a chest with 50 dollars in room 12, but you do not take any money, youâ€™re just learning about the environment. You return to the lobby. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money. Which room from the lobby will lead to the path where one can make the most money?

clarification: The room corresponding to the answer to an input is true, you can just ignore returning the last room and return the room corresponding to the answer to the input.
answer: All of the rooms

We welcome applications to the Air Force Research Laboratory's Graduate Student Innovator Program. The graduate student innovator is expected to perform research in conjunction with one or more academic researchers associated with AFRL's 711th Human Performance Wing on topics of interest. Business concepts and ideas regarding application transition are welcomed.
Project descriptions are below. Matches between student and host are expected, but not guaranteed. Students are encouraged to contact the host research providers for additional details prior to applying.
* Obstacle Density Mapping and Perception
In response to the growth of the selfie-pose 3D point-cloud map world, data from indoor mapping technologies need to be enhanced to confidently address day- and night-time scenarios. Making point density comparisons on day- and night-time images, a known rich source of information in important for future indoor optical mapping technologies. During daylight, human perceptual mechanisms can cover for sparse features, and during the nighttime it requires special attention for detectable and non-distressing maps. Perception could be conditioned

You enter the lobby and this time you encounter a new room, room 13. Room 13â€™s door leads to room 14, and room 14 leads to room 15. Room 15â€™s door leads to room 16, and room 16 leads to room 17. Room 17â€™s door leads to room 18 and room 18 has a portal, and you can choose which room to teleport into.. When you return to the lobby and choose the path that leads to the most reward, you discover that the regular door to the room with the most money is blocked. You go back to the lobby. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money. Which room from the lobby will lead to the path where one can make the most money?

That's why it's called the Scorelist.
>From the origin you choose a path that leads to the most money>user: You enter the lobby and this time you encounter a new room, room 13. Room 13â€™s door leads to room 14, and room 14 leads to room 15. Room 15â€™s door leads to room 16, and room 16 leads to room 17. Room 17â€™s door leads to room 18 and room 18 has a portal, and you can choose which room to teleport into.. There is a door in the lobby that leads to a sandwich store that has delicious sandwiches, you take the first sandwich and have a scenic view in the process. You return to the lobby. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money. Which room from the lobby will lead to the path where one can make the most money?

Experience will expand your possibilities as an entrepreneur, so make sure you gain some before you seek finance. This should be every year of your education, since a year will teach you more than many school years combined.. For the first year, you could grant management shares worth 10% of your business and a final 15% to 40% if you can realize this goal
